Trump's message emphasizes his "Make America Great Again" slogan, reflecting his continued focus on his policies and their perceived successes.

title: Phasing out fossil fuels ‘doomed to fail’, says Tony Blair as he calls for rethink of net zero policy – UK politics live
snippets:
‘Any strategy based on either phasing out fossil fuels in the short term or limiting consumption is a strategy doomed to fail,’ says former PM

Severin Carrell is the Guardian’s Scotland editor.

Keir Starmer is not expected to campaign in the Hamilton byelection, a critical contest for Scottish Labour which takes place in early June, Anas Sarwar has confirmed.

I wouldn’t expect Keir to be campaigning in the byelection. That’s not to say he won’t, but I’m not expecting Kier to campaign in the byelection.

I’ll be on the stump campaigning for a Labour win. I’m the candidate for first minister next year. I’m the one that wants to remove the SNP from government.

Next year, we’ve got to demonstrate to people that for all Nigel Farage might want to come here with his easy answers and create a bit of a circus, the reality is a vote for Reform only helps the SNP. If you want to get rid of the SNP, only Scottish Labour can beat them.

Continue reading...

Keir Starmer is not expected to campaign in the Hamilton byelection, a critical contest for Scottish Labour which takes place in early June, Anas Sarwar has confirmed.

I wouldn’t expect Keir to be campaigning in the byelection. That’s not to say he won’t, but I’m not expecting Kier to campaign in the byelection.

I’ll be on the stump campaigning for a Labour win. I’m the candidate for first minister next year. I’m the one that wants to remove the SNP from government.

Next year, we’ve got to demonstrate to people that for all Nigel Farage might want to come here with his easy answers and create a bit of a circus, the reality is a vote for Reform only helps the SNP. If you want to get rid of the SNP, only Scottish Labour can beat them.

Continue reading...
titles: Phasing out fossil fuels ‘doomed to fail’, says Tony Blair as he calls for rethink of net zero policy – UK politics live
Phasing out fossil fuels ‘doomed to fail’, says Tony Blair as he calls for rethink of net zero policy – UK politics live
summary: A former Prime Minister has declared strategies to quickly phase out fossil fuels or limit consumption as destined to fail. Meanwhile, Scottish Labour leader Anas Sarwar confirmed that Keir Starmer is not expected to campaign in the crucial Hamilton byelection in early June, focusing instead on challenging the SNP in the next year's election. Sarwar emphasizes that a vote for Reform aids the SNP, positioning Scottish Labour as the only viable option to defeat them.
constructiveness_reason: The story provides useful insights into the challenges of phasing out fossil fuels and the need for a rethink of net zero policy. It informs readers about the political dynamics in the UK and the positions of various leaders. However, it doesn't highlight any concrete solutions or progress towards solving the issue of climate change.

title: Spain and Portugal power outage: what caused it, and was there a cyber-attack?
snippets:
Several countries in Europe have been scrambling to restore electricity after a huge power cut caused blackouts

  • Spain and Portugal hit by massive power outage

Spain, Portugal and some of south-west France suffered a massive power cut on Monday, with major cities including Madrid, Barcelona and Lisbon among those affected.

Houses, offices, trains, traffic lights and even the Madrid Open tennis tournament were all hit, causing chaos for millions of people and prompting a scramble by the Spanish and Portuguese governments and network operators to understand the problem and race to fix it.

Continue reading...
titles: Spain and Portugal power outage: what caused it, and was there a cyber-attack?
summary: Spain, Portugal, and parts of south-west France experienced a massive power outage on Monday, affecting major cities like Madrid, Barcelona, and Lisbon. The blackout disrupted homes, offices, public transport, traffic systems, and events like the Madrid Open tennis tournament. Authorities in Spain and Portugal are urgently working to identify the cause and restore electricity, as millions of people face chaos due to the sudden loss of power.
constructiveness_reason: This story informs and contextualizes a major event affecting millions of people. It raises awareness about the potential vulnerabilities of power systems and the impacts of such outages. However, it doesn't provide a clear solution or progress in the situation, as the cause of the outage is still being investigated.

title: Top Stock Movers Now: Honeywell, Sherwin-Williams, Regeneron, and More
snippets:
Key Takeaways

  • Major U.S. stock indexes were higher at midday as markets awaited more information about potential White House tariff deals.
  • Honeywell, Sherwin-Williams, and Corning shares gained as all three posted strong results.
  • NXP Semiconductors warned about the potential impact of tariffs, and announced its CEO was stepping down.


U.S. equities were higher at midday as markets waited for further clarification from the Trump administration about possible changes in tariff policy. The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 0.6%, and the S&P 500 and Nasdaq were up by smaller percentages.

Honeywell International (HON) shares gained after the diversified technology and manufacturing conglomerate beat earnings and revenue estimates, raised the low end of its profit outlook, and announced plans to deal with potential effects of tariffs.

Shares of Sherwin-Williams (SHW) rose when the maker of paints and other industrial products exceeded profit estimates as it benefited from higher prices and lower costs.

Corning (GLW) shares advanced after the fiber optics company also posted better-than-expected results on rising demand for optical connectivity products used in artificial intelligence (AI) infrastructure.

Regeneron Pharmaceuticals (REGN) shares sank when the biopharma firm's earnings and revenue missed forecasts as sales of its blockbuster eye treatment, Eylea, were weaker than anticipated.

Shares of Amazon (AMZN) declined when White House spokesperson Karoline Leavitt warned that the administration would consider it a "hostile and political act" if the e-commerce platform lists the costs of tariffs on the products it sells.

NXP Semiconductors (NXPI) shares tumbled after the chipmaker announced CEO Kurt Sievers would be stepping down and warned that tariffs are causing a very uncertain environment. 

Oil and gold futures slid. The yield on the 10-year Treasury note was down. The U.S. dollar advanced against the euro, pound, and yen. Prices for most major cryptocurrencies were higher.
titles: Top Stock Movers Now: Honeywell, Sherwin-Williams, Regeneron, and More
summary: U.S. stock indexes rose midday as markets awaited updates on potential White House tariff deals. Honeywell, Sherwin-Williams, and Corning shares increased following strong financial results. Honeywell beat earnings and revenue estimates, Sherwin-Williams benefited from higher prices and lower costs, and Corning saw demand rise for its optical products. Conversely, Regeneron Pharmaceuticals and Amazon shares fell due to missed earnings forecasts and tariff listing concerns, respectively. NXP Semiconductors shares dropped as the company announced its CEO's departure and warned of tariff-related
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful information about the performance of various stocks, which could aid readers in their investment decisions. However, it doesn't report on solutions or improvements, nor does it significantly increase awareness about broader trends or impacts.

title: Scientists Bioprint Living Tissues That Could Revolutionize Diabetes Treatment
snippets: Carnegie Mellon researchers have used FRESH 3D bioprinting to create the first collagen-based microphysiologic systems, offering new hope for Type 1 diabetes treatment. Collagen is widely recognized for its role in maintaining healthy skin, but its importance extends far beyond that. As the most abundant protein in the human body, collagen provides essential structure and [...]
titles: Scientists Bioprint Living Tissues That Could Revolutionize Diabetes Treatment
summary: Researchers at Carnegie Mellon have successfully used FRESH 3D bioprinting technology to create the first collagen-based microphysiologic pancreatic tissues. This groundbreaking development could significantly impact the treatment of Type 1 diabetes by providing a new method for creating tissues that mimic the pancreas's insulin-producing capabilities. The use of collagen, a key structural protein in the human body, in these bioprinted tissues highlights a novel approach to potentially revolutionize diabetes management.
constructiveness_reason: This story is highly constructive. It provides useful information about a significant innovation in the medical field that could revolutionize diabetes treatment. It reports on progress and solutions, and increases awareness about the potential impacts of this development.

However, opponents of this idea believe that such a move could erode public trust and compromise the industry's safety record.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful insights into the ongoing debate about the role of the Nuclear Regulatory Commission. title: Alzheimer’s Breakthrough: Scientists Identify Key Enzyme That Links Brain Inflammation to Memory Loss
snippets: SIRT2, an enzyme previously overlooked in astrocytic GABA production, may be crucial for distinguishing the specific effects of degenerative molecules involved in Alzheimer’s disease. A research team at the Institute for Basic Science (IBS) has discovered that SIRT2, an enzyme previously unknown in this context, plays a key role in memory loss linked to Alzheimer’s [...]
titles: Alzheimer’s Breakthrough: Scientists Identify Key Enzyme That Links Brain Inflammation to Memory Loss
summary: Scientists at the Institute for Basic Science have identified SIRT2, an enzyme not previously associated with Alzheimer's disease, as playing a crucial role in the connection between brain inflammation and memory loss. This discovery sheds new light on the specific effects of degenerative molecules involved in Alzheimer's, potentially opening new avenues for treatment.
constructiveness_reason: This news story is highly constructive as it provides useful insights into a new discovery related to Alzheimer's disease. It reports on a solution-oriented scientific breakthrough, thereby contributing to progress. It also increases awareness about the role of a specific enzyme in the disease, helping readers understand its mechanisms better.

title: Scientists Discover Key Biological Mechanism That Promotes Healthy Aging and Longevity
snippets: Immune resilience driven by TCF7 promotes healthy aging and reduces mortality risks. Strengthening it during midlife can extend healthspan but has limited effects beyond age 70. A study published in Aging Cell has identified immune resilience as a crucial factor in salutogenesis, the active process of promoting health and well-being. Researchers analyzed data from 17,500 [...]
titles: Scientists Discover Key Biological Mechanism That Promotes Healthy Aging and Longevity
summary: Researchers have identified that immune resilience, driven by the gene TCF7, plays a vital role in promoting healthy aging and reducing mortality risks. A study published in Aging Cell, analyzing data from 17,500 individuals, found that strengthening immune resilience during midlife could extend healthspan. However, its benefits are limited beyond the age of 70. This discovery highlights immune resilience as a key factor in salutogenesis, the process of health and well-being enhancement.
constructiveness_reason: This story is constructive as it provides actionable insights into promoting healthy aging and reducing mortality risks. It reports on a scientific discovery, contributing to progress in understanding aging. It also increases awareness about the role of immune resilience in health and well-being, providing useful understanding for readers.
